news.title: Zelensky plans to meet Trump on Sunday for talks on ending Russian war
news.description: The Ukrainian leader says he will see the US president in Florida and believes "a lot can be decided before the new year".

news.title: Family of man missing at sea pay tribute
news.description: The family of Matthew Upham have named him as one of the swimmers who went missing on Christmas Day.

news.title: Boxing Day shopping falls flat once again
news.description: Although shoppers are still bargain-hunting, fewer people headed to the high streets and shopping centres compared with last year.

news.title: US launches strikes against Islamic State in Nigeria
news.description: President Trump has previously accused the Nigerian government of failing to protect Christians from jihadists.

news.title: Three people unaccounted for after house fire
news.description: One person escaped the fire but three others, who were thought to have been in the house, are missing.

news.title: The King's message tops Christmas Day TV ratings
news.description: Nearly 7m people tuned in on the BBC, ITV, Sky News and GB News to watch King Charles deliver his annual broadcast.

news.title: Quiz of the Year 2025, Part 2: What did Katy Perry sing on that all-female space flight?
news.description: Test your memory of 2025 in the second part of our quiz. What happened from April to June?

news.title: Blast at Syrian mosque during Friday prayers leaves at least eight dead
news.description: The explosion in Homs targeted a predominantly Alawite area, a sect that has faced crackdowns and violence since the fall of former-President Bashar al-Assad.

news.title: US judge blocks detention of British social media campaigner
news.description: Imran Ahmed was among five people accused of seeking to "coerce" US firms into censoring free speech.

news.title: Two killed in suspected Palestinian ramming and knife attack in Israel
news.description: Police say the attacker, from the occupied West Bank, ran over at least one person before stabbing another victim several miles away.

news.title: Girls Aloud singer Nicola Roberts pregnant with first child
news.description: The singer revealed that she and her partner, footballer Mitch Hahn, are expecting a baby in the spring.

news.title: I'm watching brain surgery to see if Alzheimer's can ever be cured
news.description: BBC health and science correspondent James Gallagher finds out if it is scientifically possible to ever cure Alzheimer's.

news.title: How to get rid of unwanted Christmas presents - without being found out
news.description: How to regift without getting caught and other options for dealing with unwanted presents.

news.title: Sydney Sweeney: I want to make films that save people's lives
news.description: Sweeney is starring in The Housemaid, a psychological thriller based on Freida McFadden's hit book.

news.title: Why Britain has a deer problem - leaving damage that costs millions
news.description: Deer numbers have rocketed over the last 40 years and particularly since the Covid-19 pandemic.

news.title: Not rocket science -  England's bowlers finally find right length after three defeats
news.description: On a day of batting collapses at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, England can at take least solace from the fact their bowling attack got their own lengths right.

news.title: Thailand bombs Cambodian border area as ceasefire talks continue
news.description: Cambodia accuses Thailand of "indiscriminate attacks", as negotiators meet for a third day to try to end weeks of renewed fighting.

news.title: Israel recognises Somaliland as independent state, Netanyahu says
news.description: The decision has been condemned by Somalia, Egypt, Turkey and Djibouti, who call it a dangerous precedent.

news.title: 'Respect the culture' - Fifa urged to allow Pride Match
news.description: An official involved with the World Cup Pride Match says there has been no contact from Fifa about their plans, despite the Egyptian FA's complaint.

news.title: 'We were overconfident': Spate of mountain rescues involving young men sparks concern
news.description: Llanberis Mountain Rescue Team say winter weather can turn a manageable day extremely dangerous.

news.title: Harry Redknapp's The Jukebox Man wins King George VI horse race
news.description: Harry Redknapp's The Jukebox Man rallies at the last to clinch a thrilling victory in the King George VI Chase at Kempton Park.

news.title: BBC News app
news.description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

news.title: The Newscast Review of the Year 2025
news.description: The biggest events of the year and what it was like on the inside as they happened.

news.title: Were our 2025 predictions right?
news.description: The Americast team open the annual end-of-year time capsule.

news.title: Unseen film footage from the making of 'Do They Know Itâ€™s Christmas?'
news.description: Rare and unseen moments from the making of the hit single by charity supergroup Band Aid.

news.title: 'Unfair' MCG pitch has 'done too much' - Vaughan
news.description: The pitch for the fourth Ashes Test in Melbourne has "done too much" and the result is in an "unfair" contest between bat and ball, says Michael Vaughan.

news.title: 'A dream' - Redknapp's The Jukebox Man wins King George
news.description: Harry Redknapp's The Jukebox Man rallies at the last to clinch a thrilling victory in the King George VI Chase at Kempton Park.

news.title: England trail by 46 runs as 20 wickets fall on hectic first day
news.description: England put in another disappointing batting display by failing to chase down Australia's opening tally of 152, as day one of the fourth Ashes Test closes with the home side leading by 46 runs in Melbourne.
